titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate in support of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization and the NATO summit to be held in Chicago, Illinois from May 20 through 21, 2012.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

committee.name: Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S1616-1618)

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Kerry without amendment and with an amended preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 349.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and an amended preamble by Voice Vote.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in Senate

bill.summary: 3/29/2012--Passed Senate without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the Senate reported version is repeated here.) Remembers the 63 years that the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) has served to ensure peace and stability in Europe and throughout the world. Honors the sacrifices of U.S. personnel, NATO allies, and partners in Afghanistan. Reaffirms that NATO, through the new Strategic Concept, is oriented for the changing international security environment and the challenges of the future. Urges all NATO members to take concrete steps to implement the Strategic Concept. Supports the 2012 NATO summit in Chicago, Illinois.
